The minor proposition, therefore, being granted, we say that the consequence of the major is invalid. For God is not bound to procure the application of his re- medy to any individual to whom he hath willed that it should be applicable; which is evident as well in corporeal as in spiritual remedies. Asthough, therefore, the death of Christ is, from the ordination of God, and the nature of the thing, a remedy of that kind, that it may be both announced and applied to every individual of the human race for the remissiori of sins, yet God is not bound by any promise to procure that it should be announced and ac- tually applied to every individual.
